title: Picture Show - Now Showing
description:
Picture Show Studios brings you the first video tease, "Now Showing". Make sure your popcorn is properly popped and buttered, you've got the best seat in the theater and your cell phones and pagers are silenced.......enjoy the show!

Filmed by Josh Stewart and Jake Todd
Edited by Josh Stewart
Song: "Heels" by S. Maharba

soundtracks.track: Bad Brains, Dr. Know, Darryl Jenifer, Earl Hudson - Gene Machine

title: Transworld - The Cinematographer Project
description: Transworld Video #24. Produced by Jon Holland, and reprising the premise and format of the original Cinematographer, The Cinematographer Project once again shifts focus on 13 of skateboarding’s most gifted videographers (four of which return from the first version), and allows them to craft short parts to share their creative visions to the world of skateboarding.

title: Picture Show - Admit One
description:
Grab some popcorn and take your seats...."Admit One" by Picture Show Skateboards is about to start. Please silence your pagers and remember refreshments are available in the lobby. 
Cast Includes: Taylor Nawrocki, Kevin Liedtke, Tyler Dietterich, John Baragwanath, Moose Abrams and Jasper Stieve

Filmed by Josh Stewart, Jake Todd, John Valenti, Brandon Stepanow, Mike Laybold and Micth Oxby
Directed & Edited by: Josh Stewart
All Music by: S.Maharba 
Track 1: SITWSM
Track 2: French Maid
Track 3: Girls In Pearls
Motion Graphics: Cameron Linderman
Make-up Effects: Allyson Atchison

soundtracks.track: Boards Of Canada - Ready Let's Go
El Michels affair - You're All I Need

title: Baker - Baker Bootleg
description:
Way back before there was Baker Skateboards, Birdhouse Skateboards released this little underground skateboard video called Baker Bootleg. It has nothing to do with any specific skateboard company. It was just a bunch of skateboard footage from skaters like: Andrew Reynolds, Jim Greco, Brian Sumner and Ali Boulala. Actually there were a lot of video parts in there, but those are some of the bigger names that come to mind. 

This is the video that sets the tone and style for what Baker Skateboards was going to become. It really is the first Baker video. It's funny because there was a video for the company before a skateboard company ever formed. So if you want to see some young Reynolds and Greco footage this is the video where it's at. 

This video circulated and became quite popular. Soon enough two skateboard companies formed from this video (well sorta). The first company was Baker Skateboards and the other was Bootleg Skateboards. Baker was started by Andrew Reynolds and Bootleg was started by J. Strickland. Unfortunately Bootleg didn't last as long as Baker...

title: In The Whip
description: "Ty Dubois drops his first full length with “In the Whip,” showcasing some of the rawest talent that bleeds from the East Bay to Seattle. You may or may not know some of these folks, but one thing’s for sure – they ain’t playing around out here. From the Oakland sideshows, to Seattle’s port, all the makings are here for a masterpiece full length." -LowCard Mag

title: Transworld - Modus Operandi
description: Transworld Video #10. Along with the most condensed cast of any previous TransWorld video, generator-powered night footage and a highly synthesized soundtrack set Modus Operandi apart from other videos of its time. Directed and edited by Ty Evans and Jon Holland, parts featured Marc Johnson’s “pure thought turned reality” and dramatic slow mos from Chany Jeanguenin and the Expedition crew.

soundtracks.track: Rabbit in The Moon - FLooRi.D.A. (LunaSol's Sub-Aqua remix)
Spiritualized - Ladies and Gentleman We Are Floating in Space

title: Streets: NYC
description: Satva Leung gives you the NYC breakdown, from the hottest skate spots to where to go out and rage at night, street art, and local knowledge from pros, legends, and lurkers such as: Kareem Campbell, Zered Bassett, Danny Supa, Jack Curtain, Josh Kalis, Geo Moya, Vinny Ponte, Rodney Torres, Jeff Pang, and some NYC Locs. Cruise through Manhattan, Brooklyn, Midtown, Brooklyn Banks, and Flushing.

soundtracks.track: DJ Mutt - I'll Do The Bridge

title: Pepper - Pepper Promo
description:
Please enjoy this short dose of visuals showcasing a small sect of our talented team riders from around the globe.  Timeless and raw skating cut clean for your consumption!
Pepper Grip exclusive G5 formula in full effect!

soundtracks.track: Modest Mouse - Sunspots In The House Of The Late Scapegoat
I Like Big Tits - Joe Walsh

title: SF Greatest Misses 1994-1997
description: "Greatest Misses is to San Francisco what Revisted was to New York, and it basically sums up the city’s overall contribution to the development of skating more than anybody’s part in Questionable or Video Days, even if its coverage begins a bit late at 1994. Greatest Misses tends to put things into perspective via a history lesson in the same way it remains to be a fun video to watch before you leave the house to go skate."

soundtracks.track: Young Cellski - Livin in the Bay
Lou Reed - Walk on the Wild Side
Young Cellski - Livin in the Bay

title: Dickies - Vincent Alvarez's "Great DIY Adventure"
description: Vincent's been clockin' in with Dickies for a decade, lacquering ledges, reviving spots and stacking clips. Here he tosses on the safety vest and pours some 'crete in the street.

description: Habitat's double hitter short film featuring a 2019 east coast tour & full length Suciu part. Primary Filming: Matt Schleyer, Joe Castrucci, Chris Mulhern, Andy Licardi / Editing & Graphics: Joe Castrucci

title: Static IV
description:
When we think about independent productions, the first that springs to mind is the "Static" series by [url=http://www.instagram.com/mystaticlife]Josh Stewart[/url], the result of 15 years spent filming and travelling around the world with some of the best skateboarders out there.
[align=center][img]http://images.bigcartel.com/bigcartel/product_images/140931910/max_h-1000+max_w-1000/STATICIV_PACKAGING_WEBIMAGE4.JPG[/img][/align]
The Static series grand finale brings an overwhelming amount of talent from NYC to SF, Florida to London, and Paris to LA and wraps it all up with a series of cameos and surprises that will satisfy any fan of underground skateboarding. 
[align=center][img]http://images.bigcartel.com/bigcartel/product_images/140931913/max_h-1000+max_w-1000/STATICIV_PACKAGING_WEBIMAGE2.JPG[/img][/align]
Featuring: Aaron Herrington, Quim Cardona, Jake Johnson, Yonnie Cruz, Vivien Feil, Ben Gore, Jimmy Lannon, Kevin Tierney, Steve Brandi, Jahmal Willams and many others.
[align=center][b]Get Static IV/V [url=http://theoriesofatlantis.bigcartel.com/product/static-iv-dvd-package][u]HERE[/u][/url][/b][/align]
